### Computing and plotting time series of wind speed and direction

The stormBehaviour_pt function allows computing wind speed and direction for a given location or set of locations (provided with a data frame with "long" and "lat" columns) along the lifespan of a tropical cyclone.

E.g. computing and plotting time series of the speed and direction of winds generated by the topical cyclone Pam (2015) at Efate (longitude = 168.33, latitude = -17.73) in Vanuatu.

Une reference Ã  #time_series


``` {r time_series}
library(StormR)
df<-data.frame(lon=168.33,lat=-17.73)
st <- getStorms(loi = "Vanuatu", names = "PAM", verbose=0)
ts <- stormBehaviour_pt(st, points = df)
plot(ts$PAM[,1]~ts$PAM[,3],type="b",xlab="Observation ID",ylab="Wind speed (m/s)")
plot(ts$PAM[,2]~ts$PAM[,3],type="b",xlab="Observation ID",ylab="Wind direction (degree north)")
```

- Obtenir le PDI et 'time_exposure' aux points de `df`
- Exemple avec plusieurs points
- Manipulation du dataframe de sortie
- Sauver le dataframe
